summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to attorney Sigrid McCawley, notifying her that Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys intend to file a new bail application. The email serves as a courtesy update ahead of the filing.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Recipient of the email notification regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's upcoming bail application. She is being kept informed by the prosecution.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email; her attorneys are preparing to file a new bail application in her criminal case.

connections.description: McCawley is being formally notified by the prosecution about legal proceedings (bail application) concerning Maxwell, indicating McCawley has a legal interest in the case, likely representing a victim or party with standing.

events.title: Notification of Upcoming Bail Application
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails Sigrid McCawley to inform her that Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team intends to file a new bail application. No filing or hearing date is set at this time.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys were preparing a new bail application as of December 3, 2020.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York proactively notified attorney Sigrid McCawley about this upcoming legal action.
The correspondence demonstrates ongoing legal proceedings and the prosecution's practice of keeping relevant parties informed ahead of filings.
